title: US to Revoke China Waivers for South Korean Chip Firms
description: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde discusses US plans to revoke waivers granted to Samsung and SK Hynix that authorized them to move some equipment from China without a license. Plus, Dell and Marvell shares fall after earnings disappointments. And, US regulators are embracing the blockchain and SEC Commissioner Mark Uyeda discusses the agency’s crypto-friendly steps. (Source: Bloomberg)

argos_summary: The U.S. Commerce Department announced it will revoke the waivers that allowed Samsung Electronics and SK Hynix to ship chip equipment from China without a license, tightening export controls on semiconductor manufacturing. The move comes amid broader U.S. efforts to curb China’s chip supply chain and is expected to impact the global semiconductor market. Meanwhile, Dell and Marvell shares fell after earnings disappointments, and U.S. regulators are advancing a crypto‑friendly agenda, with the SEC Commissioner outlining new blockchain initiatives.
